Problem:
Consider a linear transformation system defined by \\( y(t) = e^{At}x \\), where A is a constant matrix and x is an initial vector. Evaluate the effect of the transformation \\( g(z) = Cz \\), where C is another constant matrix, on the system.

Given the state \\( y(t) \\) at t = T, can we ascertain the initial vector \\( x \\) without knowing whether the transformation \\( g(z) = Cz \\) was applied at time t = 0?
Explanation: Lacking the knowledge about the initial application of \\( C \\), it is impossible to accurately backtrack to \\( x \\) since multiple initial conditions can evolve to the same \\( y(T) \\) depending on the presence or absence of the transformation \\( C \\) and the properties of A.
